document_metadata.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: The cumulative dose of cisplatin has been shown to effectively control tumor growth in mice [47].

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Cisplatin-treated mice showed an impaired performance in the Y maze test, as evidenced by a reduction in the rate of perfect alternations (Fig. 1b), implying a decreased spatial working memory function (post-hoc test, p = 0.0086).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Taken together, these findings indicate that cisplatin impaired spatial working memory, executive functioning, and problem-solving abilities in mice and, more importantly, that the brain-penetrating HDAC6 inhibitor ACY-1083 reversed these deficits.

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Of note, we showed previously that ACY-1083 and ACY-1215 are equally effective in reversing cisplatin-induced peripheral neuropathy [31].

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: However, treatment with ACY-1215 in the same schedule that reversed peripheral neuropathy did not restore cognitive function (Fig. 1c) (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 20) = 0.3809, p = 0.54).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: No differences were detected in the total interaction time with objects (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 31) = 0.6425, p = 0.4289) (Fig. 2b), indicating that cisplatin and ACY-1083 had no effect on locomotor activity or interest in the objects..

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Taken together, these findings indicate that cisplatin impaired spatial working memory, executive functioning, and problem-solving abilities in mice and, more importantly, that the brain-penetrating HDAC6 inhibitor ACY-1083 reversed these deficits.

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Taken together, these findings indicate that cisplatin impaired spatial working memory, executive functioning, and problem-solving abilities in mice and, more importantly, that the brain-penetrating HDAC6 inhibitor ACY-1083 reversed these deficits.

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Figure 3a shows that cisplatin treatment decreased Î±-tubulin acetylation in the brain (post-hoc test, p = 0.0408) and that this was reversed by ACY-1083 treatment (post-hoc test, p = 0.0170).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: As shown in Fig. 3b, cisplatin did not change the protein level of HDAC6 in the brain (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 12) = 0.7129, p = 0.4150).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Figs. 4aâe, cisplatin treatment led to morphological damage to synaptosomal mitochondria, as evidenced by an increased percentage of atypical mitochondria that were swollen and/ or had abnormal cristae structure (post-hoc test, p = 0.0256).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Figs. 4aâe, cisplatin treatment led to morphological damage to synaptosomal mitochondria, as evidenced by an increased percentage of atypical mitochondria that were swollen and/ or had abnormal cristae structure (post-hoc test, p = 0.0256).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Furthermore, cisplatin induced significant decreases in parameters measuring synaptosomal mitochondrial bioenergetics, including the maximal respiratory capacity (MRC) (post-hoc test, p = 0.0416) (Fig. 4f ) and spare respiratory capacity (SRC) (post-hoc test, p = 0.0147) (Fig. 4g). ACY-1083 treatment also restored cisplatin-induced impairment in MRC (post-hoc test, p = 0.0345) and SRC (post-hoc test, p = 0.0291) (Fig. 4f and g).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Furthermore, cisplatin induced significant decreases in parameters measuring synaptosomal mitochondrial bioenergetics, including the maximal respiratory capacity (MRC) (post-hoc test, p = 0.0416) (Fig. 4f ) and spare respiratory capacity (SRC) (post-hoc test, p = 0.0147) (Fig. 4g). ACY-1083 treatment also restored cisplatin-induced impairment in MRC (post-hoc test, p = 0.0345) and SRC (post-hoc test, p = 0.0291) (Fig. 4f and g).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Cisplatin and ACY-1083 did not affect basal respiration (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 20) = 0.6219, p = 0.4396) (Fig. 4h) or ATP-coupled respiration (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 20) = 0.02046, p = 0.8877; n = 6) (Fig. 4i).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Cisplatin and ACY-1083 did not affect basal respiration (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 20) = 0.6219, p = 0.4396) (Fig. 4h) or ATP-coupled respiration (two-way ANOVA, F (1, 20) = 0.02046, p = 0.8877; n = 6) (Fig. 4i).

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: The results in Figs. 5 demonstrate that cisplatin reduced the expression of the presynaptic marker synaptophysin (post-hoc, p = 0.0005 for CA1, p < 0.0001 for DG) and the postsynaptic marker PSD95 (post-hoc, p = 0.0138 for CA1, p= 0.0065 for DG) in the CA1 and DG regions of the hippocampus.

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

citation.name: Pharmacological inhibition of HDAC6 reverses cognitive impairment and tau pathology as a result of cisplatin treatment.

links.evidence: Treatment with 14 doses of the HDAC6 inhibitor ACY-1083 starting 3 days after completion of cisplatin treatment, completely reversed this cognitive deficit (post-hoc test, p = 0.0074) (Fig. 1b).
